loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Ayélé âgée de 44ans est mère de 02enfants qui vont à l’école. Ils sont âgés de 19 et 17ans. Depuis  2007, elle vend dans une boutique de la boisson locale « SODABI » à toutes personnes. Pour renforcer son stock, elle sollicite de WAGES un second prêt pour acheter de la marchandise. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et comme perspectives d’avenir elle voudrait acheter en quantité considérables pour vendre, tirer un maximum de profit et bien entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Ayélé is 44 years old and the mother of two children, ages 19 and 17, who both attend school.

Since 2007, she has been selling a local drink, Sodabi, in a shop.  Her customers come from all walks of life.

In order to boost her inventory and buy more merchandise, she is requesting a second loan from WAGES. 

She wants to reinvest in her business.  In the future, she would like to buy in very large quantities in order to sell at a better price, to make more profits, and to take good care of her family.

loans.use: to buy alcoholic beverages.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
This is Daniel, 52, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Analyn and a father to their children.   He and his wife manage their  household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Daniel maintains a tricycle business. He owned and drives a tricycle unit (a motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working early in the morning and continues until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late evening until the wee hours in order to have bigger profit. His regular customers are neighbors and the local community.   He earns a minimum of PHP 300 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations, he is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. He will be using the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Daniel hopes to buy another tricycle and hopes to support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work. It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle vehicle.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Es Grande Group

texts.es: La Sra. Lila es conviviente, tiene 38 años de edad y tiene 5 hijos en edad escolar, Lila  es integrante  de la alcancía comunal  “El Esfuerzo es Grande”, grupo conformado por 9 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Lila  trabaja vendiendo comida, marcianos desde hace 4  años a su vez vende sanguches y salchipapas en las noches en un carrito sanguchero, Lila inicia este negocio con la idea de ayudar con los gastos de la casa ya que el sueldo de su esposo no era suficiente,Lila trabajo muy duro,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha  logrado darles a sus hijos educación, ha construido su casa  y a su vez le ha brindado una mejor calidad de vida a  su familia. Con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos (papa, pollo, etc). Lila  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y agradece a Edaprospo y kiva por el prestamo.
texts.en:
Lila, 38, has a partner and five school-aged children. She is a member of the communal bank "El Esfuerzo es Grande" (Effort is Great), a group made up of nine members who work in various trade activities. Lila has worked selling food and popsicles for four years. At night she also sells sandwiches and salchipapas (fried potatoes with hotdogs) from a sandwich cart. Lila started this business with the idea of helping with home expenses since her husband's salary wasn't enough.

Lila works very hard. Thanks to her effort and dedication she has been able to give her children an education, she has built her house, and at the same time, she has given her family a better quality of life. With the goal of continuing to work, she is applying for a new loan to buy ingredients (potatoes, chicken, etc.) Lila will meet her goals with a lot of work and effort. She is grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (potatoes, chicken, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
This is Rosana, who is 40 years old and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Placido and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosana operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She profits by buying supplies at wholesale and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosana hopes to grow her business and dreams of givng her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of their work.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Dukuzanye Group

texts.fr:
Thomas fait partie du groupe Dukuzanye et habite  Bujumbura. Il a  55 ans et est mariée à  Olive, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de  12 à  20 ans,tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce de manioc sec et de la farine de manioc depuis  20 ans. 

Il est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de manioc sec; une partie sera revendue comme telle,une autre sera transformée en farine avant la vente, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Thomas is a member of the Dukuzanye group and lives in Bujumbura.  He is 55 years old and married to Olive, a seller.  Thomas and Olive have eight children, ages 12 to 20, who all attend school.

Thomas has been selling dried cassava and cassava flour for the past 20 years.

This is his seventh loan with Turame.  With his loan from Kiva, he will boost his capital and buy a large a quantity of dried cassava, part of which will be sold as such, while the rest will be processed into flour before being sold.  This loan will ultimately help him to make more money.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of dried cassava (part of which will be sold as such, while the rest will be processed into flour before being sold).

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
This is Annabelle, who is 36 years old and a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Danny, a security guard, and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Annabelle oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They own one tricycle, a motorcyle plus sidecar, that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a bounty (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

 To help continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Annabelle dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of their work.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle vehicle.

loans.name: Basima

texts.en: Basima is 40 years old and a mother of five. She has a number of goats that she uses to get milk and make some dairy products for sale. She has applied for this loan to increase the number of goats she has to increase her productivity.

loans.use: to increase the number of goats she has.

loans.name: Twibesheho Group

texts.fr:
Rose fait partie du groupe Twibesheho et habite à Gitega. Elle a 37 ans et est mariée à  Joseph, un commerçant et cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants dont 5 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce  de banane  et de vin de banane depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de bananes certaines seront revendus comme telles et d’autres seront transformées en vin de banane à vendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Rose is a member of the Twibesheho group and she lives in Gitega.  She is 37 years old and married to Joseph, who is involved in farming and business.  Rose and Joseph have seven children, five of whom are in school.

Rose has been selling bananas and banana wine for the past ten years.

This is her 12th loan with Turame.  With her loan from Kiva, she will boost her capital and buy large quantities of bananas, some of which will be resold as such, while others will be processed into banana wine for resale.  This loan will ultimately help Rose to make more money.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of bananas to be sold as such or processed into banana wine.

loans.name: Niño De Praga  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Niño de Praga es un banco comunal formado por 8 mujeres que viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que cautiva por su belleza colonial y moderna, la calidez de su gente y su variada gastronomía, tiene diversos lugares para disfrutas y vivir gratos momentos saliendo de la rutina diaria del trabajo. Su gente es muy cálida y amable, su mejor cualidad es que son muy trabajadores, laboran diariamente en sus diferentes actividades como propietarios de negocios o empleados, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Irma, este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. Tiene 26 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo de 7 años de edad que estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado público, la casa en la que viven es de propia.

La Señora Irma labora diariamente como empleada privada, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, el resto de su tiempo lo dedica enteramente a su familia.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra  de útiles escolares para su hijo ya que esta próximo el ingreso a clases.
 
Su meta es tener una boutique y así ser independiente en el trabajo.
texts.en:
The Niño de Praga communal bank is comprised of eight women who live in different places in the city of Cuenca.  It is a captivating city because of its colonial and modern beauty, the warmth of its people, and for its varied gastronomy.  It has diverse places to enjoy and to spend pleasant moments leaving behind the daily work routine.  Its people are warm and kind.  Their best quality is that they are very hard-workers.  They work every day in their different business activities as proprietors of their own businesses or as employees.  They still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

Irma is one of the members of this group.  This is her first loan in the communal bank, which a friend invited her to join.  She is 26 years old, and she is in a common-law marriage.  She has a seven year old son who goes to a city school.  Her husband works as a public employee, and they live in their own house.

Irma works every day as a private employee.  She works Mondays through Saturdays from nine in the morning until five in the afternoon.  She devotes the rest of her time entirely to her family.

She will use the loan to buy school supplies for her son because it is close to the time for him to start classes.

Her goal is to have a boutique and in that way become independent in her work.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Pucacruz  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Pucacruz  está formado por 8 socias quienes son todas amigas y de una misma comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, parroquia que tiene varios lugares para disfrutar, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo antiguo. Las socias son personas amables, cálidas y  algunas se dedican a laborar en el comercio, pero su trabajo en común es la cría de animales y la agricultura, también mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos lo cual es un orgullo.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Dolores, este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. Tiene 48 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su último hijo de 15 años de edad está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, una de sus hijas hace 7 años ha emprendido el viaje pero desde que salió de su casa nunca más tuvo noticias de ella y aun espera que ese día llegue. Su esposo es agricultor, la casa en la que vive es propia.

Doña María Dolores se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y al arduo trabajo del campo, ella siembra papas, verduras y hortalizas las que vende en la ciudad, también cría cuyes, borregos, cerdos y gallinas a los que los vende en su comunidad.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas, cuyes y cerdos de una mejor raza.

Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunas puertas y ventanas
texts.en:
The "Pucacruz" communal bank is made up of eight members who are all friends from the same community, which is in the parish of Valle in Cuenca. It's a parish that has many places to enjoy; its architecture is a mixture of modern and historical. The members are kind, warm people; some of them earn a living working in markets, but the work that they have in common is raising animals and agriculture. They are also proud to maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

One of the members of this group is María Dolores. This is the first loan that she has taken out in the communal bank, which she was invited to join by a friend. She is 48 years old, married, and has four children from her marriage. Two of them are married and live on their own, and her youngest son, who is 15 years old, is studying at a school in the city. Her other daughter set out on a trip seven years ago, but they haven't had any news from her since she left the house; they are still hoping that that day will arrive. María Dolores's husband is a farmer, and they own the house they live in.

María Dolores spends her time doing household chores and working in the fields. She grows potatoes and vegetables that she sells in the city. She also raises guinea pigs, lambs, pigs, and hens, which she sells in her community.

She will invest her loan in the purchase of better breeds of hens, guinea pigs, and pigs.
 
Her goal is to finish her house since it still lacks some of the doors and windows.

loans.use: to buy hens, guinea pigs, and pigs.

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Lach is a 47-year-old married woman who has been raising piglets as her main source of income for ages, followed by a rice farming business. 

When the piglets mature, she usually sells them to butchers who come into her village. For additional income, Lach owns a general store, selling a mixture of various things in front of her house. 

Another main income is from her spouse, who is operating a firewood-trading business. He typically generates about 7.20 USD per day. Lach has five children: the oldest one is already married; two of them have jobs while the other two are still attending school. She needs to pay daily allowances for her two school-aged children.

As of now, Lach would like to borrow 1,500 USD to purchase two buffaloes for farming tasks as well as for pulling the firewood trailer. 

She hopes to improve her family-owned businesses and yield more revenue to ensure a good living standard for her family.

loans.use: to purchase two buffaloes for farming as well as for pulling a firewood trailer.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Las oportunidades para los jóvenes profesionales siguen siendo escasas en Perú.; pero esto no es impedimento para que jóvenes como Alexander, quieran emprender un futuro a través de una carrera tan fascinante como la Ingeniería Ambiental y de Recursos Humanos.  Alexander de 30 años de edad actualmente trabaja y estudia para poder apoyar a su familia y conseguir los materiales necesarios para su carrera; sin embargo, esto no es impedimento para que sus calificaciones lo ubiquen dentro de los 10 mejores de su promoción.  En el futuro, Alexander planea estudiar inglés para poder postular a una beca en el extranjero y poder especializarse en Ingeniería de la Naturaleza, y así poder cumplir el sueño de sus Padres y su mayor meta profesional; el de aplicar todo lo aprendido para el desarrollo de recursos naturales en Perú.  Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en el pago de las mensualidades de sus estudios. Alexander tiene un gran empeño por su desarrollo educativo y promete no defraudar a quienes lo están apoyando a cumplir sus metas y agrádese la confianza depositada el.
texts.en:
Opportunities for young professionals continue to be scarce in Peru.  But, this is not an obstacle for young people like Alexander who want to undertake a future through a career as fascinating as Environmental Engineering and Human Resources. Alexander, 30 years old, currently works and studies to be able to support his family and obtain the necessary materials for his career.  Yet, this doesn't get in the way of his grades placing within the 10 best in his class.

In the future, Alexander plans to study English to be able to apply for a scholarship abroad and be able to specialize in Environmental Engineering, and in this way fulfill the dream of his parents and his biggest professional goal - to apply all that he has learned for the development of natural resources in Peru.  He will invest the recent loan in making monthly payments for his studies.  Alexander has great determination for his educational development and promises to not disappoint those who are helping him to achieve his goals and thanks them for the confidence put in him.

loans.use: to make the monthly payments for his studies

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras- Chupuro Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos fraternales desde Perú! Les presento al Grupo Mujeres Luchadoras – Chupuro;  grupo que está iniciando su segundo ciclo y formado por 8 socios que, como su propio nombre lo dice, son mujeres 100% luchadoras. Que sacan adelante a su familia con los ingresos de sus pequeños negocios administrados por ellas mismas.
Una de estas mujeres luchadoras es Carolina de 47 años que vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Como no son suficientes los ingresos que su esposo recibe ella se dedica a la venta de comida típica en las Fiestas patronales que por su excelente sazón la han hecho muy reconocida y a sus platillos muy demandados; asimismo, ella también vende viandas en el cafetín de una escuela ubicada en su localidad
Carolina se caracteriza por ser una de las mas trabajadoras y muy puntuales en sus pagos. El sueño de ella es de contar con un local propio, donde hacer un restaurant turístico, ya que sus principales clientes son los turistas que visitan su pueblo.
El crédito que ella solicitó es para la compra de sus insumos (Ajíes especiales, arroz, aceite, verduras, etc.), ya que se acercan fechas festivas, bailes típicos, etc. en su localidad.
Carolina es la primera persona de la derecha, viste un polo verde con rayas negras. * En la foto superior se puede observar a  Ruth con una gorrita negra y Gloria  esta con una chompa ploma.
texts.en:
Friendly greetings from Peru! I’d like to introduce you to the Grupo Mujeres Luchadoras--Chupuro. The group is just starting its second loan cycle. It’s made up of eight members, who, as their name suggests, are 100% hardworking women. They wish to help their families get on in life with the income from their small businesses.

One of these hardworking women is 47-year old Carolina who lives with her husband and four children. As her husband doesn’t earn enough to support the family, she sells traditional food at festivals. Her dishes are well-known for their delicious flavour and are much in demand. As well Carolina sells lunches in a nearby school cafeteria. 

Carolina is known as one of the most hardworking women and is very punctual with her loan repayments. Her dream is to have a space of her own where she can run a tourist restaurant as her main customers are the tourists who visit her town. The money she is seeking will be used to buy ingredients (special peppers, rice, oil, vegetables) as the dates of festivals and local dances are fast approaching. 

Carolina is the first person on the left in the photo. She is wearing a green top with black stripes. In the upper photo you can see Ruth in a black hat and Gloria in a grey sweater.

loans.use: buy rice, oil, and special peppers

loans.name: Las Begonias Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú, quiero contarles la historia de un grupo de personas que con esfuerzo y dedicación salen a delante diariamente para lograr sus objetivos. Ha  si se caracteriza  el grupo las begonias conformado por 12 integrantes, uno de ellas es  la Sra. Ana de 54 años de edad   casada y madre de 5 hijos, quien diariamente se dedica a la confección de disfraces para eventos de danza y actuaciones escolares. Se inició en ello tras ver que el colegio de sus sobrinos en cada fecha especial, se realizaban actuaciones en las cuales se alquilaban muchos trajes típicos y de moda, para los bailes y presentaciones de los mismos. Es por ello que en 4 años ha logrado consolidar una clientela que le permite aportar en los gastos de su hogar y ahorrar para su anhelado sueño, la construcción del segundo piso de su casa. El reciente préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de telas para hacer los disfraces. La Sra. Ana y el grupo las Begonias están agradecidos por la confianza y el préstamo brindado, ya que les generara un empuje más para  lograr sus metas en el futuro.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru. I would like to tell the story of a group of people who, with effort and dedication, come out ahead each day to achieve their objectives. This is how the group of twelve members, “Las Begonias,” characterizes itself. 

One member is Ana, who is 54 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Every day she makes her living sewing costumes for dance events and school plays. She started this after seeing that her nieces’ and nephews’ school performed plays on every special day, and for which it rented many traditional and stylish outfits for the dances and plays. It is because of this that in four years she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home and save for her longed-for dream, the construction of the second floor of her house. 

She will invest the recent loan into the purchase of cloth to make disguises. Ana and the group “Las Begonias” are thankful for the trust and the loan given, since it will generate one more push for them to achieve their future goals.

loans.use: to buy cloth to make costumes

loans.name: Libertadores Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú. Quiero presentarles al grupo “Libertadores” conformado por personas deseosas por surgir en la vida, este grupo fue creado entre vecinos y  lo llamaron así por la zona en la que viven, actualmente cuenta con 9 integrantes  que se dedican desde muy temprano al comercio y prestaciones de servicios. Un ejemplo de ello es el Sr. Miguel de 38 años de edad soltero y esforzado emprendedor se dedica diariamente al servicio de electricista y  cuenta con trabajos eventuales en una empresa prestando sus servicios, pero también alquila un espacio de su casa como cochera de moto taxis. Al Sr. Miguel  le gustaría poner una pequeña empresa de servicios eléctricos en el futuro y así mejorar su casa ya que es muy precaria. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en compras de herramientas para sus trabajos de electricista. El Sr. Miguel se encuentra muy agradecido por el préstamo otorgado y también por la confianza  brindada.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru. I would like to introduce you to the Libertadores Group which is made up of people who wish to get on in life. They are all neighbours and have chosen to name the group after the place where they live. Currently there are nine members and they work in various occupations such as business and services. 

38-year old Sr. Miguel is one of the members. He is single and a hardworking electrician who gets casual work at a local business. He also works as a taxi driver. Miguel would like to open a small electrical services business in the future and also make some improvements to his house which is in need of repair. 

With the loan he plans to buy tools for his work as an electrician. He is very grateful for the loan and the confidence shown in him.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Patron Santiago - Chongos Bajo Group

texts.es:
PATRON SANTIAGO:
Hola !!!!!!!!!, Buenos Días, saludos de todos sus hermanos peruanos, hoy les presento al Grupo conformado solo por mujeres, ellas son 7 vecinas que por su afinidad formaron el grupo llamado “Patrón Santiago” -  Chongos Bajo.
Rosa, socia de este grupo es una joven madre de tan solo 24 años que convive con el padre de su único hijo; su esposo trabaja en la mina lo cual lo lleva a pasar con su familia sólo 7 días al mes,
Rosa se dedica al bordado manual de “Fustanes” (Vestimenta típica de esta parte del país, que son usados para sus fiestas patronales), que es realmente un arte, este oficio lo heredo de sus padres, quienes también de dedican a esta labor.
Ella en su localidad es muy reconocida por la calidad de los bordados que realiza, a pesar de ser tan joven. Ella nos cuenta que cada uno de estos fustanes le demora en algunos casos hasta 30 días de dedicación.
texts.en:
Hello, good day, and greetings from Peru! Today I present to you the all-woman "Patrón Santiago--Chongos Bajo" group. They are seven neighbors who formed the group because of their common interests.

Rosa, a member of the group, is a young mother—only 24 years old—who lives with the father of her only son; her spouse works in the mine, which allows him to spend only seven days a month with his family.

Rosa earns her living hand-embroidering "fustanes," a traditional item of clothing of this part of the country that is worn for patron saint festivals. This is really an art. The trade was passed down from her parents, who also did this work.

In her town, Rosa is very well-known for the quality of the embroidery that she does, despite being so young. She tells us that each of these "fustanes" takes, in some cases, up to 30 days of work.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric.

loans.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú!  Les presento al grupo Las Aguilas


Este grupo está conformado por 10 socias. La mayoría se conocen y participan dentro del grupo cerca de 6 años, Hilda es uno de sus miembros. Ella  tiene 48 años, es separada con 02 hijos. Hilda se dedica a la venta comidas, empezó en este negocio gracias a su cuñada que le incentivo a trabajar con ella, ambas repartían desayuno a trabajadores de varios lugares, con el tiempo por motivos de salud su cuñada le dejo el negocio a ella, en la actualidad Hilda cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo mayor; ambos se levantan muy temprano para llevar y repartir desayuno a sus clientes que en su mayoría son trabajadores de una galería y oficinas cercanas, los pedidos que reparten son jugos, infusiones, quinua y sándwichs de todos los sabores. Su trabajo es muy sacrificado por eso le gustaría tener un puesto de venta estable cerca al lugar donde reparte los desayunos, así no gastaría en movilidad y no tendría transportar tanto peso desde su casa, por otro lado su trabajo le permite solventar los gastos de su familia  sobretodo los estudios de sus hijos, gracias a su préstamo podrá comprarse una refrigeradora que será de mucha ayuda para su negocio ya que esto le permitirá conservar frescos  los alimentos que vende.
¡Hilda agradece su apoyo!

*Hilda aparece en la foto con vestido floreado en blanco y negro.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! I would like to introduce you to the Aguilas Group which is made up of ten members, the majority of whom know each other and have participated in the group for about six years. 

Hilda is one of the members. She is 48 years old, separated from her husband, and has two children. She sells food, a business she began with help from her sister-in-law who encouraged her to work with her. They both used to deliver breakfasts to workers in various places. However, her sister-in-law became ill and left the business to Hilda. Currently Hilda runs it with help from her eldest daughter. They get up very early to take the food to their customers, most of whom work in a nearby shopping mall or offices. They serve juices, teas, quinua, and different types of sandwiches.

As the work is very hard, Hilda would like to have a permanent stall close to the place where they deliver the breakfasts. That way she wouldn’t have travel expenses and wouldn’t have to transport so much heavy food from her house.

Hilda’s income provides money for household expenses and also her children’s education. With the loan she will be able to buy a refrigerator which will be a great help as it will allow her to keep the food cold. 

Hilda is very grateful for your help. In the photo she is wearing a black and white flowery top.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Al-Hana Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Hana and consists of four women and one man. They live in Aden, Yemen. 

Najiba is a happy woman who treats everyone well because of her opportunities to get ahead. She, like many people, has had good times and bad ones and has gotten ahead despite whatever stands in her way. She is 54 years old, married and has two adult children. She is worried about her house, so she applied for a loan of 50,000 Yemeni rials from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to remodel the inside of the house and make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to remodel the inside of her house

loans.name: Ivett Irene

texts.es:
Les presento a Ivett, una joven estudiante de Farmacia en la universidad

Ivett solicito su préstamo para pagar la matrícula y la mensualidad de su nuevo ciclo en la universidad, así podrá continuar sus estudios con tranquilidad. Ella cursa el 7mo ciclo y  para graduarse solo le faltan 02 años. Ivett es una jovencita muy dedicada a los estudios, lo que más desea es terminar su carrera para poder trabajar en alguna de las grandes cadenas de farmacias en el país. Ella esta agradecida por su préstamo que le permitirá continuar con sus estudios para ella sería muy difícil continuar si no fuera por esta ayuda, debido que para sus padres muchas veces es difícil juntar el dinero para sus pensiones, por eso esta agradecida a los inversionistas por el apoyo que brindan a todos los jóvenes con ganas de superarse.
texts.en:
I'd like to introduce you to Ivett, a young pharmacy student at the university.

Ivett is requesting a loan to pay her admissions and the monthly fees in her new university term so that she can continue her studies without worries.  She is in the 7th term and to graduate she only needs 2 more years.  Ivett is a very dedicated student in her schooling.  What she most wants is to finish her degree so that she can work in one of the large pharmacy chains in her country.  She is very thankful for the loan that will allow her to continue with her studies.  It would be very difficult for her to go on if it weren't for this help, since her parents often have a very a difficult time putting together money for her room and board.  That is why she is grateful to the lenders for the support they offer to all the young people who want to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay her admissions and room and board

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Min is from Prey Chor District in Kompong Cham Province. He is 41 years old and the father of three children attending school. Rice farming is his main business and the sole source of income for his family. He has been doing farming for many years with the constant support of his wife and teenage children. He typically earns a suitable income of 8,000 KHR per day. Min and his wife aim to improve their farming business and grow various kinds of seasonal crops to yield a better income. He plans to plant beans, followed by rice crops. But due to inadequate capital, he would like to have financial assistance through HKL in the amount of 900 USD to purchase bean seeds, hire laborers to prepare the land, and also pay the operating expenses for growing rice. With the great help of the loans, Min has a strong commitment to make improvements to his current business and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bean seeds, hire laborers to prepare the land, and also pay the operating expenses involved in the rice-growing process

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
This is Miguela, 44, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to her children, and is married to Celso, who works as a security guard. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Miguela operates a pineapple farm. She grows pineapples on their farm in Cavite. It is in the high lands, which are suited to growing pineapple. She sells her product to markets and fruit stores that she regularly supplies, and to the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Miguela dreams of being able to give all her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Felix Daniel

texts.es:
Felix quiere convertirse en un exitoso ingeniero de sistemas, para eso sigue una carrera universitaria, su mayor motivación es ayudar a sus padres y ser un buen ejemplo para sus hermanos, el préstamo que ha solicitado lo usara para pagar las pensiones de su nuevo ciclo. Félix está realizando sus practicas y algunas veces hace trabajos pequeños para algunas empresas,por lo cual recibe algunos pagos; este ingreso le sirve para la compra de sus  libros y también para cubrir sus pasajes para la universidad, el cuenta con la ayuda de sus padres que siempre lo apoyan alentándolo a seguir con sus estudios, ya le falta menos de 2 años para terminar la carrera y convertirse en un profesional.
Felix quiere agradecer a los inversionistas por ayudarle a cumplir sus sueños!
.
texts.en:
Félix wants to become a successful systems engineer, so he is pursuing a university degree. His biggest motivation is to help his parents and to be a good example for his siblings. 

He will use the loan that he is requesting to pay the tuition for his next term. Félix is doing his labs, and sometimes he does small jobs for some businesses, earning himself some money. He uses this income to buy his books and also to cover his university transportation costs. He has his parents' help; they always support him, encouraging him to continue with his studies, as he now has less than two years left to finish his degree and become a professional.

Félix wants to express his gratitude to the investors for helping him to fulfill his dreams!

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
This is Soledad. She previously received a 35,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in meeting her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Soledad hopes that her business will continue to grow.  She wants to give her children a good and quality education. She wants all her children to finish their studies and fulfill their own dreams and aspirations in life. She wants them to have a comfortable life. 

She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as she strongly believes that as Christians we must have quality time devoted to our Creator. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en:
Tho, aged 57 years, is a humble farmer living in Kompong Cham province with her spouse and two single children, while three other children are living separately after marriages. 

She has been in the farming business for more than 30 years, with her expertise in this field. She owns a few hectares of farmland on which she primarily grows rice both for sustenance and for sale. Her husband always helps in farming and also devotes his time to a carpentry business. He is skilled at making boats, and he frequently does carpentry work whenever there are orders or requests from customers. 

Because of a lack of carpentry supplies, Tho’s husband won’t be able to grow his business into a success, and this will be his challenge in the business. 

Tho would like to help her husband in pursuing good growth of his business and supply him with the tools he needs for his carpentry work. Consequently, she has applied for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase carpentry tools, such as a metal smoothing plane, jigsaw, chisels, and a handsaw. 

She believes that this purchase will enable her husband to become more productive, and she hopes that he will have more customers.

loans.use: to purchase carpentry tools for her husband.

loans.name: Mancita

texts.en:
Mancita is 42 years old and married, with two children. 

She buys and sells bananas. She has been in this business for almost three years and is doing well. 

At this time, she would like to request a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more bananas. 

She believes that this loan will help her to improve her capacity of sales, and she hopes she can save for the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von is 29 years old and married with a school-aged child. She lives in the Baray district. Von operates a small general store from her house to help her husband earn income and she sells a mixture of various things to the local people in her community. She usually earns a decent profit to cover her daily food. This is just her supplemental business and the family's main business is rice farming. 

Von is requesting a 600,000 KHR loan through HKL to add to her savings and purchase wallboard and other items to fix her home. Her present house is old and she dreams of having a suitable house to provide comfortable living conditions for her family. Von is very thankful for a loan to better her living status.

loans.use: to purchase wallboard to replace her old broken ones

loans.name: Maritza Monserrate

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente del Cantón Sucre cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad. El marido se dedica  a la pesca. Lleva 11 ciclos en el banco comunal y le agrada por los beneficios que ofrece la institución.
 
Ella además de ser una muy buena ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo para lo cual ella tres o cuatro veces por semana se desplaza por toda su localidad ofreciendo sus productos, además de esto todas las tardes y noches ella se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, lo que más vende son los chuzos y alitas de pollo con plátano asado, lleva más de dos años dedicada a estas actividades y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para preparar sus bocadillos, plátanos, sodas y ropa de todo tipo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que sus hijos tengan lo mejor.
texts.en:
In the seaside resort of San Clemente in the canton of Sucre, the "1 de Diciembre" communal bank meets every fifteen days. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, which are popular with many domestic and international tourists. It offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of traditional regional dishes.

In this location lives Maritza. She is 26 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has two children who are five and three years old. Her husband makes his living in fishing. She has been in the communal bank for 11 cycles and she is grateful for the benefits offered by the institution.

On top of being a very good housewife, Maritza also works in sales, selling all types of clothing. Three or four times a week, she goes all around her town, offering her products for sale. In addition to that, every afternoon and evening, she works selling fast food. What she sells the most of are "chuzos" [meat skewers] and chicken wings with roasted plantains. She has been working at these activities for more than two years and they are going quite well.

Maritza is going to use this loan to buy ingredients for preparing the foods she sells, plantains, sodas, and all kinds of clothes.

Her goals are to continue progressing in her business and for her children to have the best.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients, plantains, sodas, and clothes.

loans.name: Ho

texts.en:
Ho is 56 years of age and a responsible mother with six children, four of whom are married and two who are single. All of her children are employed and they each share some of their income to help their old parents. Ho is an industrious farmer as well as a pig-raiser who works honestly to generate income day-to-day by the sweat of her brow. She doesn’t want to utterly depend on her children’s remittances.

Ho is requesting a loan to purchase potato plants and pay for laborers to work on her plantation. With the help of lenders, she hopes to make good progress in her business and to have a fruitful harvest in the coming season. In the future, Ho wants to purchase extra land to expand her production.

loans.use: to purchase potato plants and pay for laborers to work on her plantation

loans.name: Ngaet

texts.en:
Ngaet is 59 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. For the past ten years, she has been involved in breeding pigs and she earns approximately 2 USD per day. Ngaet's husband is a construction worker who earns about 5 USD daily. All of her children are employed and earn about 8 USD each day. 

Ngaet is requesting a 600 USD loan to purchase piglets to raise, breed, and resell when they gain weight. Her loan will improve her family’s livelihood. In the future, Ngaet will use her profit to expand her business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise, breed, and resell

loans.name: Pelagiaa

texts.en:
This is Pelagiaa, 55, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Agustin, her business partner, and mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Pelagiaa operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy slippers and sandals at wholesale price and sell them per item with a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices. She also operates a variety store for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy larger quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Pelagiaa hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock needed for her business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
This is Lucila, 46, who is a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Alejandro and a mother to her children. Together with her husband, Lucila manages her household while operating a small variety store where she sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5-PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Lucila earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members and she earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales daily. Lucila works hard to continually provide a income for her family's everyday expenses. 

Lucila is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory and help continue operating her business. Lucila expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Groups gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocerie items and products to sell

loans.name: Thav

texts.en:
Thav is 62 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been running a pharmacy for more than ten years, earning about $5 daily. Her husband is a doctor who earns about $6 each day. 

In order to expand her pharmacy, Thav is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more medicines to resell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and to help her child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines for her pharmacy.

loans.name: María Isolda

texts.es:
En el balneario San Clemente del Cantón Sucre cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo ya no trabaja por motivos de salud.

Ella al ver que ya su esposo no podía trabajar con los ahorros que tenían invirtió en surtir un pequeño bazar el mismo que lo tiene en su casa y en el cual junto a su esposo atienden, allí trabajan todos los días aunque los días que más vende son los fines de semana días en los cuales llegan muchos turistas hasta este hermoso balneario. Allí vende de todo un poco desde ropa, zapatos, hasta helados, sodas, hielo y muchos otros productos que sus clientes necesitan. Lleva 5 años con su negocio y es ahora la única fuente de ingresos que tienen para salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su bazar va a comprar ropa, zapatillas, helados, sodas, etc. para vender. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de  14 años  y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the seaside resort town of San Clemente in the canton of Sucre, the "1 de Diciembre" communal bank meets every fifteen days. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, which are very popular with many domestic and international tourists. It offers a diversity of beautiful spots and a rich variety of traditional regional dishes.

In this place lives María. She is 53 years old, married, and has four children from that marriage, all of whom are adults and live independently. Her husband no longer works for health reasons.

Upon seeing that her husband would not be able to work anymore, María invested the money they that had saved in stocking a small variety store in their house. Together with her husband, she works in the shop every day, although the days when they sell the most are the weekends, when many tourists arrive in the beautiful beach town. They sell a little of everything, from clothes and shoes to ice cream, sodas, ice, and many other products that their customers need. They have had this business for five years, and now it is the only source of income they have to live on.

María is going to use this loan to stock up their shop. She is going to buy clothes, sneakers, ice cream, sodas, etc., to sell. She has been in the communal bank for more than 14 years and she likes it for the benefits that the institution offers.

Her goals are to carry on with her business and to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sneakers, ice cream, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 38, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo, a driver, and mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marilyn oversees the operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, regular customers are from the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marilyn dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Mwaminifu Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is in her early 30s and married with one young child. For the past five years, she has run a grocery business. Fatuma's business is doing very well and works daily and is able to make monthly profits of about 900 USD. She is a member of the loan group "Mwaminifu," which has 19 members who hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. 

Fatuma is requesting her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her grocery stock and purchase products such as beer, soda, water, and other alcohol. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as beer, soda, and water

loans.name: Ang

texts.en:
Ang is 40 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling fruits for more than two years, earning about $4 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. 

In order to improve her family’s living condition, Ang is requesting a loan of $800 to raise capital to purchase more fruits to resell. 

In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she wants to build a kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to resell.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn is 33 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been working in garment factory for more than three years, earning about $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $2 daily. Her daughter is a tailor who earns about $3 each day. 

Sophorn is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase cloth for her daughter to make clothes to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her daughter’s shop and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for her daughter to make clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cows for farming purposes.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal is 43 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in purchasing poultry to resell for more than ten years, earning about $3 per day. 

Phal is requesting a loan of $500 to raise capital to purchase more poultry to resell. 

In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to puchase more poultry to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional stock of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Dolores Miladis

texts.es:
En el balneario San Clemente del Cantón Sucre cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 25, 19 y 15 años, los mayores estudian en la universidad de Manta y el menor estudia en colegio. El marido es obrero.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para ganarse el sustento diario y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar hace tiempo atrás instalo un bar en su casa, allí vende bocadillos y comidas rápidas, además de sodas, aguas, jugos, entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 15h00 hasta las 21h00, esta temporada que se avecina es muy buena ya que llegan muchos turistas de la sierra hasta este hermoso lugar a pasar sus vacaciones y es cuando ella mas vende por eso necesita de urgencia el crédito para surtir su negocio.
 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar sodas, aguas, jugos y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  7 años y le gusta porque con los créditos pudo poner su negocio que le ha servido de mucho y por la unión que hay en el banco.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The 1 de Deciembre (December 1st) Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the seaside resort town of San Clemente, in the canton of Sucre.  The community is well known for its beautiful beaches, and is a popular destination for domestic and foreign tourists alike.  The community offers a variety of beautiful sights and a rich selection of foods that are typical of the region.

Dolores is one of the residents of this community.  She is 54 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and has three children, ages 25, 19, and 15; her two oldest children are in university, while her youngest child is in high school.  Her husband works as a laborer.

Dolores is a homemaker who installed a snack bar in her house in order to help her husband support the family and cover the household expenses.  She sells sandwiches and fast food, along with soft drinks, bottled water, juices, and other items.  She works every day from 3:00 in the afternoon until 9:00 at night.  The upcoming season is very good for business, since lots of tourists from the mountains will come to San Clemente to spend their vacations.  This is the time of year when Dolores makes the most sales, and that is why she urgently needs a loan so she can restock her business.

Dolores is going to use the loan to purchase soft drinks, bottled water, juices, and supplies for food preparation.  She has been a member of her communal bank for 7 years, and enjoys being a member because the loans allowed her to set up her business, which has made a big difference; she also enjoys the unity among the members of the bank.

Dolores’s dream is to have a large restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bottled water, juices, and supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
This is Pablita, 54, resident of Taguig, Philippines. Her husband is Aladino, and she is mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Pablita operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell at a little profit. Her products are bags, women's accessories, rain boots, umbrellas and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy RTW [Ready-To-Wear] products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Pablita hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and draw her family more closely to God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of supplies and products needed in her business

loans.name: Grupo Hatarinas Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú, les presento al grupo  Hatarias conformado por 5 integrantes los cuales son un ejemplo de que con perseverancia y mucho esfuerzo los objetivos se pueden alcanzar. Una de ellas es la Sra. Paola de 21 años de edad, es la más joven del grupo, a pesar de su corta edad tiene una hija de 3 añitos  quien es su impulso cada día para salir adelante ante  las adversidades de la vida ya que es madre soltera. La Sra. Paola trabaja prestando servicio  de elaboración de tortas y decoración, buffet, aprendió este negocio gracias a una amiga quien le enseño todo lo necesario, es una joven emprendedora ya que también vende productos de belleza, trata de salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y gracias al apoyo de su familia lucha todos los días para alcanzar sus metas. Con el reciente préstamo lo  utilizara, en la compra de insumos y materiales para la realización de tortas, en el futuro  le gustaría poder tener un puesto de venta de Dulcería; La Sra. Paola al igual que todos los socios del grupo Hatarinas está muy agradecidos con la confianza y apoyo que  les brindan con el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru. We present to you the Hatarinas Communal Bank made up of five members, who are an example that goals can be reached through perseverance and great effort. One of the members is Sra. Paola, 21, the youngest of the group. Despite her young age, she has a 3-year-old daughter who is her reason for moving ahead every day in the face of life’s adversities, since she is a single mother.

Paola works making and decorating cakes and preparing buffets. She learned the business thanks to a friend who taught her everything necessary. She is a young entrepreneur because she also sells beauty products. She is trying to get ahead through great effort and thanks to her family’s support she struggles every day to achieve her goals. She will use the recent loan to purchase supplies and materials to make cakes and in the future she would enjoy being able to have a stall selling sweets. Paola and the other members of the Hatarinas Communal Bank are very grateful for the support and confidence shown in them through the loan that was provided.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and materials to make cakes.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en:
Prom is 48 years old and the diligent mother of six children.  

She is in the business of raising piglets for sale. She has a wooden pen in her backyard where she installed and fattened four or five piglets.  When they mature, she usually sells them to local traders and butchers who come into her village; she earns about 2.40 USD per day. 

Prom’s husband also helps provide income for this family by selling firewood house to house and in the marketplaces, with his two buffaloes and trailer, generating around 8 USD each day. Prom’s husband would like to improve his firewood-trading business. 

As usual, Cambodian people prefer to use a plowing machine with a trailer attached at the back for transporting items such as rice, corn, firewood, and especially seasonal crops after collecting them from the fields. Prom’s husband is hoping to have one to support his present business.  It’ll take less time, and he can reach the marketplaces very quickly. 

To help her husband in this matter, Prom has applied for a loan to buy a plowing machine for both farming and his firewood business. 

In the future, Prom aspires to bring a success for her family and to work out her plans to attain financial stability someday.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine for both farming and the firewood business.

loans.name: Chan Toun

texts.en:
Chan Toun is 36 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been working in garment factory for more than two years, earning about $3 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 each day. One of her children is employed in garment factory as well. 

Chan Toun is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. 

In the future, she would like to run an additional business to earn more income for the family and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintain her computer arcade business.

loans.name: Los Quinuales - Concepcion Group

texts.es:
BUENOS DIAS!!!!, reciban los cálidos saludos de todos sus hermanos peruanos. Hoy les presento al Grupo “Los Quinuales - Concepción” grupo que está formado por 8 socios que se conocen hace ya más de un año. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es Clotilde de 56 años de edad y con 3 hijos; hace 8 años quedó viuda y tuvo que afrontar sola con la responsabilidad de su hogar. Gracias a su esfuerzo ella pudo educar a sus hijos y tiene uno que está en la universidad. 
Ella es una mujer trabajadora que supo sacar adelante a sus hijos con los ingresos que obtenía de la venta de abarrotes, que es su actividad principal. Ella por las tardes también se dedica al trabajo en el huerto en su comunidad. El préstamo lo utilizará en la compra de mercadería como: Arroz, azúcar, Leche, Fideos, etc, que los venderá en su pequeña tienda. 
Clotilde se encuentra muy contenta porque personas que no son de su país se muestran muy interesados en su historia y en el sueño que cada uno de los integrantes de su grupo, por eso ella quiere agradecer a cada uno de los socios de Kiva y al equipo de Edaprospo por colaborar con su progreso.
Clotilde es primera de la izquierda. *En la parte superior izquierda se encuentran Fabiola con chompa lila y  Lupe con una casaquilla de color turquesa.
texts.en:
Good Day! Accept warm greetings from all your friends here in Peru. Today we present to you “Los Quinuales - Concepción” Communal Bank, which is made up of eight members who have known each other for more than a year.

One of the members of this group is Clotilde, 56, who has 3 children. Eight years ago she was widowed and had to assume the responsibilities of her household alone. Thanks to her efforts she was able to educate her children and has one who is in the university. She is a hardworking woman who knew how to move her children ahead with the income she earned by selling groceries, which is her principal business. She also works in the orchard in her community in the afternoons. She will use the loan to purchase the merchandise she will sell in her small store, such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, etc.

Clotilde is very happy because people who are not from her country are very interested in her story and in the dreams that each one of the members of her group has. For that she wants to thank each one of the members of Kiva and the team at Edaprospo for collaborating in her progress.

Clotilde is the first person from the left in the photo. On the upper left side are Fabiola, wearing a lilac sweater, and Lupe with a turquoise turtleneck.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Fe Mira

texts.en:
This is Ma. Fe Mira, 47, a resident of Bacoor, Philippines. She is married to Alito and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Fe Mira operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ma. Fe Mira hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products to sell

loans.name: Mary Joyce

texts.en:
Mary Joyce finished her education with a Bachelor of Science degree in Accounting. She is happily married and living with grandchildren and three children. Her spouse and one child are Overseas Filipino Workers.

Mary Joyce has been operating a general store. She is very thankful to God Almighty because of the blessings she received. Mary Joyce desires to expand her store and be able to establish a computer shop as soon as possible. To make all these things possible, she works hard and minimizes her daily expenses.

Mary Joyce has been a borrower of ASKI for seven years. She is really glad, because for a long period of time she has been able to maintain her good track record as a borrower. She would like to increase the volumes of merchandise but her capital is not enough due to the expenses of starting her computer shop. So, she asked for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more merchandise to satisfy her customers' demands and encourage more people to buy in her retail store.

She hopes that someday she can continually maintain her retail store business in order to send her grandchildren to higher levels of education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her retail store business

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie runs a small store selling grocery items to the people in her village. The store is open as early as 6 am. In a day, she earns PHP 300. It goes for meals and the allowances of her children. She has two children in college. Melanie is now 47 years old and wants to borrow a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy noodles, canned goods, and soap to sell.

Melanie's concern is not only about acquiring a good income but also about offering good costumer service. This will help achieve her goal of economic stability.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, and soap to sell

loans.name: Khek

texts.en:
Khek is a 45-year-old married woman who has been residing in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She and her spouse help each other in handling their farming business on their inherited farmland. They have been in this occupation for almost seven years old, typically earning approximately 2.40 USD per day. Most of their profit goes for sustenance, clothing and other allowances for their children. This couple has given birth to six children, all of whom are still single and living together with them under the same roof. Currently, her two oldest sons are working in the construction industry to help the family financially. For additional income, Khek also operates a small store from her home where she sells many types of grocery items. 

Khek would like to increase the stock of merchandise to sell in her store in order to satisfy her customers living in her community. But due to the shortage of funds, she is asking for a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase beverages, snack foods, sweets, canned items, noodles, spices, and other miscellaneous household thing items. With any remaining funds, she will purchase a few sacks of chemical fertilizers for her rice crops. She believes that this loan will have a positive impact on her business as well as her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, snack foods, sweets, canned items, noodles, spices, and other miscellaneous household items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery items and products to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
This is Marlyn. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marlyn hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and products to sell

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
This is Romel, 39, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. His wife is Teresa, and he is a father to his children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Romel operates a buy and sell business. What he basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them with a little profit. His products are shoes and slippers for men and women. Customers are tempted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options he offers. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Romel hopes to be able to expand his business in the coming years and dreams of giving his family a good future. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Patricia Amarilis

texts.es:
En el balneario San Clemente del Cantón Sucre cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar vive la señora Patricia tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 9, 7 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian  en escuela. Su esposo  se dedica a la pesca y en ocasiones  también realiza fletes en una moto taxi.

Ella es  una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de zapatos y  productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres  días a la semana de dos a tres  horas diarias y en los momentos que está desocupada,  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana, además los fines de semana ella con el esposo alquilan sillas y carpas a los turistas que llegan hasta este lugar. Tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y toldos ya que los que tiene ya están dañados y necesita renovarlos. Lleva más de 4 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Sus sueños es terminar su casa ya que aún le falta mucho.
texts.en:
In San Clemente resort in Sucre canton, the “1 de Diciembre” Communal Bank meets every 15 days. The place is known for its beautiful beaches, which are heavily visited by both national and international tourists. It offers a diversity of beautiful places and a variety of delicious traditional regional dishes.

Sra. Patricia lives in this place. She is 30 years old, married and has three children from this relationship. The children are 9, 7 and 3 years old and the two older ones are studying in school. Her husband is a fisherman and he also occasionally carries freight on a motorcycle taxi.

She is a great homemaker who sells shoes and Yanbal products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies accessories) in order to earn her own income.
