Vann’s son helps her earn income to elevate their living standard by operating a small electronics repair shop at home, where he provides his services to local people in his village. 

Vann's son wants to purchase electronics spare parts for his store, so that he can keep his business secure as well as stabilize his income. However, he has insufficient capital for that. Vann would like to help her son financially with this purchase, so she decided to take out a loan in the amount of 1,200,000 KHR to purchase more electronics spare parts for her son’s repair shop. In the future, Vann wishes to open an electronics shop for her son, where people can buy electrical equipment and get repair service.

loans.use: to purchase more electronics spare parts for her son’s repair shop.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
This is Lanie, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lanie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lanie hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
This is Elvie, 43, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to her six children. She, together with her chidren, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Elvie operates a shoe and umbrella-repair shop. Her shop is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are in the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales daily. 

 To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw materials needed in her business. She expects a boost in income as she expands her business.  

Elvie hopes her business grows and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 43, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jerry, a construction supervisor, and is a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Evelyn maintains a direct selling business. She sells cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also has a variety store. A variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood   She earns a minimum of Php 2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Evelyn hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to have a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en: Having a big family led Laila to start a small retail business at home to help her husband. She sells blankets and some home appliances, but now she is almost out of goods and for that reason she has applied for this loan to bring in more home appliances for sale.

loans.use: to bring in more home appliances for sale

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Majeda is a mother of four children; they live in a rented house. Her husband has a small business selling used furniture from which he supports the whole family. Majeda decided to help her husband by applying for this loan to bring in more furniture so he can move his business into a separate independent store rather than having the furniture at home.

loans.use: to bring in more used furniture for sale

loans.name: Hadiya

texts.en: Hadiya is a mother of three daughters and a son. Her husband serves in the military. She has a small business at home which is a small convenience store where she sells detergents and other home products. She has applied for this loan to enhance her business by adding more shelves and stocking more goods and products to increase her profits.

loans.use: to add more shelves and stock more goods.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, She previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 22,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Imelda hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams that her children will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira, 45 years old and a  married woman, has a sewing and tailoring business at home where she makes clothing items and repairs them too. She has applied for this loan to buy a new sewing machine so she can in the near future employ a few people to help her.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 47-years-old father of four. He owns and works in a barbershop from which he is supports his family. Being the only income they have, Abdallah decided to work on improving the barbershop's internal decoration so he can add more seats and include other services in the future. For that purpose, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to work on improving the barbershop's internal decoration.

loans.name: Ribhiyeh

texts.en: Ribhiyeh is a loyal wife who is living with her in-laws. She has no children. Having a lot of free time, she started a small home business selling clothes, blankets, and bridal make-up sets. For her it’s a way to be a productive woman and a way to support her husband to improve their living conditions. She has applied for this loan to purchase a new collection of clothes clothes for the upcoming holiday season to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman, a 25-year-old single guy, is one of a 10-member family living together. He is an independent person who rented a store and turned it into a mini-market that is serving the area to support him and help with the family financial matters. Now Ayman has applied for this youth loan to increase the inventory he has of goods and food products so he can increase his profits and buy the store instead of renting it.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of goods and food products

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa, 38 years old, is the mother of six. She is a hardworking mother who is helping the family by working as a teacher while her husband is a restaurant manager. After that, she started working with her husband at home, recycling wooden scraps to make beautiful furniture and decoration pieces. They collect the scraps from everywhere and sometimes buy them if that isn’t enough. Their house is their catalog: people come over and chose what they want them to make. 

Sometimes they get some help from carpenters for shaping difficult pieces because they lack the machines. Safaa has applied for this loan in order to buy new tools that will help them make new shapes and add more artistic drawings to what they do, so they can in the future have their own carpentry shop.

loans.use: to buy new tools that will help them make new shapes on wood

loans.name: Suhair

texts.en:
Suhair, 34 years old, is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Her husband is a tailor who has a small tailoring workshop where he makes equestrian uniforms and sells them locally. He hopes that one day he can start selling to buyers outside the country. Suhair wants to support her husband so she applied for this loan to help first in improving the workshop itself and bring in more fabric so he can achieve his dream soon.

loans.use: to buy more fabric for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Eid

texts.en: Eid is a  54-years-old father of six. He owns a small stationery and office supplies store. His oldest daughter is pursuing her BA degree. He has applied for this loan to support his daughter in her studies and to pay for her registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's registration fees.

loans.name: Rola

texts.en: Rola is a  36-years-old mother of four children. She has a small home business selling women's clothes. She recently started making straw baskets and trays as well. She has applied for this loan to get more straw and other raw materials, and to add more clothing items to prepare for the coming Islamic holidays.

loans.use: to get more straw and other raw materials.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa, a 49-year-old conservative woman, asked one of her sons to take her place in the photo. Najwa and her family have a tailoring business that she wants to enhance, so she has applied for this loan to purchase another sewing machine, more thread and some raw materials.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.es: El Sr. Marlon, de 28 años de edad, es casado, habita en la comarca El Recreo, su esposa es ama de casa, tienen un hijo de 6 añitos de edad, Marlon es una persona responsable, honesto y muy dedicado a su labor; Trabaja en el Inta desempeñando el cargo de Jornalero por mas de 6 ños, con su trabajo y esfuerzo propio ha podido hacerse acreedor de su casa propia. Solicita este credito con el animo de comprar 40 laminas de zinc, ya que el techo esta en mal estado y lo quiere reparar antes de que entre en lleno el invierno.  Su sueño es brindarle comodidad a su familia y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
Marlon, 28 years old, is married and lives in the region of El Recreo. His wife is a homemaker, and they have a 6-year-old son. Marlon is a responsible person, honest and very dedicated to his work. He has worked for Inta as a day laborer for more than six years. Through his own work and effort he has been able to make himself deserving of his own home. 

He is asking for this loan with the intention of buying forty sheets of zinc, since the roof is in poor condition and he wants to repair it before winter begins. His dream is to give comfort to his family and enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy zinc for the roof of his house.

loans.name: Driffin

texts.en:
Driffin has been raising hogs for more than five years. He is separated and has two children.

Driffin would like to have a better way of life and a stable source of income. In order to make his dreams come true, he spends his time raising his hogs well and cultivating his rice fields so that his ventures are more productive. He believes that his hopes will be realized because he has the ability to obtain them. 

However this time, Driffin struggles due to a shortage of finances. For this reason, he is requesting additional working capital of 7,000 PHP, which will allow him to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines in order to ensure that his hogs are healthy and have optimum growth. This loan will really help his business grow, which will enable him to gain more income and an improved lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda, a 23-year-old single lady living with her parents and four siblings, is attending a college in pursuit of a BA degree. She has applied for this loan to pay for her semester fees in order to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Manwah

texts.en: Manwah, a 61-year-old widow, is taking care of her five sons and daughters by herself. To sustain the family, she conducts a home-based sewing and embroidery business using beads and threads. Manwah has applied for this loan to purchase more raw materials and more colorful beads.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials and more colorful beads.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en: Ibtisam, a 27-year-old married mother of one son, sells kitchen wares and clothing items to help sustain and improve the family's living conditions. She is now requesting this youth loan to buy more goods and a new clothing collection.

loans.use: to buy more goods and a new clothing collection.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 58-year-old father of six sons and three daughters. In order to support his big family after retirement, he opened a small kiosk selling hot drinks that is working out very well. Mahmoud has requested this loan to purchase a greater variety of hot drinks and herbs to serve.

loans.use: to purchase more hot drinks and herbs.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan de 38 años de edad, casado habita en el casco urbano de El Rama, se caracteriza por ser una persona honrada, trabajadora y sobre todo con ganas de superar. Su esposa es ama de casa; El  Trabaja como Jornalero desde hace 10 años para la Institución del Inta, de donde obtiene su ingreso para el mantenimiento de su familia.  solicita este  credito para la compra de zinc, y asi poder cambiarle el techo a su Vivienda, que actualmente lo tiene en mal estado.  		
Su deseo principal, es ver su vivienda en excelentes condiciones y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan, 38, is married and lives in downtown El Rama.  He is known to be honest, hardworking, and most of all, to have a strong desire to succeed.  His wife is a housewife, and he has worked as a day laborer for INTA (Nicaraguan Institute of Agricultural Technology) for 10 years.  This is where he earns the income to support his family.  He is requesting this loan to buy corrugated metal roofing material so that he can replace the roof on his house, which is currently in bad condition.

Juan's main desire is to see his home in excellent condition and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal material

loans.name: Susana Filomena

texts.es: La Sra. Susana de 54 años de edad, casada, habita en el barrio el Recreo,es una persona muy honesta,trabajadora y con ganas de superar; tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, los cuales estudian su educacion primaria, la sra. Susana trabaja para el Inta desde hace 8 años como Jornalera, junto con su esposo han logrado tener sus cosas entre ellas una casa. Solicita este credito para compra de materiales de construccion ya que quiere hacer un anexo en la vivienda de 16 mts2, ya que sus hijos están en edades crecederas y necesitan tener privacidad en el hogar.  Sueña en tener todas las condiciones establecidas en su hogar para asi poder brindarles mayor comodidad a su Familia que tanto aprecia.
texts.en:
Susana is 54 years old, married, and lives in the neighborhood of Recreo. She is a very honest, hardworking woman who is eager to get ahead. She has two minor children who attend primary school. Susana has been working for Inta for 12 years as a day laborer. She has managed together with her husband to obtain among other things a house. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy construction materials so they can add 16 square meters to their house, since their children are growing up and need some privacy at home. She dreams of having a well established home to provide comfort to her family that appreciates it so much.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to expand her home to provide privacy for her children

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
Israa is 24 years old and married, with two children. 

She has a hobby in planting, and she likes flowers, so she decided to follow her passion and start a planting business at home.  She has applied for this youth loan in order to bring in more seeds and new types of decorative plants in hopes that one day she can have her own greenhouse for planting flowers, too.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and new types of decorative plants

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Tailleur de profession, Mr Kokouvi âgé de 48ans est marié à une coiffeuse et ils ont 05 enfants en charge. 01 seul est scolarisé. Après avoir fini son apprentissage, il exerce son activité depuis 1992 à domicile.Il est aidé par 02 personnes dans l’exécution de son activité. En plus de la couture, il vend des articles de mercerie. C’est dans le but d’acheter plus de marchandises qu’il sollicite un premier prêt dans notre institution. Il veut aider ses apprentis avec les profits réalisés. A l’avenir, il souhaiterait agrandir son activité tout en améliorant le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Kokouvi is 48 years old and a tailor by profession. He is married to a hairdresser, and they have five children living in their care, one of whom has received schooling.

After having completed his apprenticeship, he started working from home in 1992. He has two people that help him carry out his work. In addition to dressmaking, he sells sewing supplies.

He is seeking his first loan from our institution in order to buy more goods. He wants to use the profits to help his apprentices. In the future, he wants to expand his business and increase his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El Sr. Juan, tiene la edad de 52 años, es soltero, habita en el casco urbano de El Rama, vive con sus padres, quienes dependen de él, Don Juan se caracteriza por ser una persona creativa, muy trabajadora y de buenas costumbres, Labora como Jornalero para el Inta desde hace mas de 10 años de donde obtiene sus ingresos para el sustento de su linda familia.Con el presente Financiamiento pretende comprar materiales de construccion para realizar un Servicio Higienico y así mejorar la calidad de Vida de su familia.  Sueña con luchar cada dia para ir mejorando poco a poco el patrimonio de el y su Familia.
texts.en: Juan, 52, is single and lives in downtown El Rama.  He lives with his parents, who are dependent upon him.  Juan is known for being a creative person who is very hardworking and has good habits.  He has worked for INTA (Nicaraguan Institute of Agricultural Technology) for 10 years; this is how he gets the income to support his beautiful family.  With this loan, he plans to buy construction materials to build a bathroom.  In this way, he will improve his family's quality of life.  He dreams of striving each day to gradually improve the property that he has with his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Jose Bismarck

texts.es: El Sr. Jose Bismarck de 34 años de edad, casado, tienen dos hijos, habita en El Rama, Jornalero,  trabaja para la Institucion del INTA hace mas de 6 años, es una persona trabajadora, le gusta compartir con sus Familiares y Amigos, es bien querido por sus vecinos. Solicita este prestamo con la esperanza comprar Materiales de Construccion asi como piedras canteras, Cemento Hierro entre otros pues tiene la ieda de hacer un anexo en su vivienda y asi darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad y comodidad. Su mayor deseo es que no le falte el trabajo para continuar mejorando sus condiciones de vida y darle lo mejor a su Familia.
texts.en: Jose Bismarck, 34, is married and has 2 children.  He lives in El Rama, and has worked for INTA (Nicaraguan Institute of Agricultural Technology) as a day worker for more than 6 years.  He is a hardworking person who enjoys sharing with his friends and relatives, and he is well-liked by his neighbors.  He is requesting this loan with the hope of being able to buy construction materials such as: quarry stones, cement, steel and other items.  He plans to add on to his house to provide his family with greater stability and comfort.  His main dream is to never be without work, so that he can continue to improve his living conditions and provide the best for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to add on to his house

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married and has been blessed with three children. Her husband is a farmer; he manages their half-hectare rice field. She is happy and thankful to God that all of her children are college graduates and professionals. Two of her children are married and living outside of the home while the youngest is still single and working.

Erlinda has been retailing cosmetic products for three years. She would like to use her direct selling business to earn income independently, gain profits and sustain their daily needs. 

She would like to buy additional cosmetic products but she needs more capital. For this reason, she is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP. This amount would mean a lot to her, in particular it would make her direct selling business more profitable. She hopes to obtain this loan so that she can gain greater income for social security purposes when she and her husband are no longer able to work.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetic products for her direct selling business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina.  She previously obtained a PHP 36,000 loan that she used to buy more quantities of meat and vegetables to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in meeting her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 36,000 loan to purchase fruits, vegetables, fish, and other products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gina dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of their work.  it is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of fish, fruits, and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Cinderella

texts.en:
This is Cinderella, She previously received a PHP 13,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in meeting her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 23,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. 

Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Cinderella hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of their work.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jesus Mi Salvador Group

texts.es:
Saludos del Perú  les presento al grupo “Jesús el Salvador” conformado por 05 socios responsables, la gran mayoría vecinos de la zona, la cual pasan al 3 ciclo. En esta oportunidad conocerá a Claudio el tesorero del grupo.
Claudio brinda servicios de mantenimiento, planchado y pintura de vehículos lleva trabajando de esta manera hace mas de 07 años, la cual alquila un local donde puede ofrecer dichos servicios. Se siente orgulloso por los logros que ha conseguido, pues a podido mejorar su vivienda y actualmente apoyar a unos de sus sobrinos en su educación.  Su mayor deseo es de tener su propio taller de mantenimiento de vehículos.  Solicito el crédito para la comprara aceite y pinturas para vehículos. Claudio es viudo y no tiene hijos. El esta agradecido esta agradecido con el crédito brindado, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Claudio es el primero del lado izquierdo viste camisa a rayas y pantalón celeste.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!   We present the communal bank "Jesus el Salvador," which is made up of 5 responsible members, most of whom are neighbors from the area.  This bank is in its 3rd loan cycle.  At this time, we will get to know Claudio, the treasurer of the group.

Claudio does maintenance and body work on vehicles.  He has been in this line of work for more than 7 years.  He rents a place where he can offer these services.  He feels proud of his achievements, as he has been able to improve his house and is currently supporting one of his nephews in his education.  Claudio's biggest desire is to have his own auto repair workshop.  He is requesting a loan to buy motor oil and automotive paints.  Claudio is a widower, and does not have children.  He is grateful for the loan that is being provided, as it will allow him to continue to improve.  In the photo, Claudio is on the far left wearing a striped shirt and blue pants.

loans.use: to buy motor oil and automotive paints

loans.name: Poch

texts.en:
Poch is from the Baray District and lives happily with his wife and some of his children. He is 47 years old and the father of six children – one married child and five single children. For extra income, Poch’s wife raises a few piglets in their backyard for future sale.

Poch has managed a rice farming business as his primary source of income for more than 15 years. He has learned to improve his farming practices gradually from operational experience. Though Poch has worked very hard in life, he is still happy because his wife and children have always been his motivation in managing their farming business. 

Currently, Poch would like to take out a loan through HKL to purchase a piece of farmland to expand his rice production. Through this purchase, Poch hopes that he will be able to make improvements to his current business as well as his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland to expand his rice production.

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en:
Rice farming has been a focused business for Nguon’s family since her parents passed down this business to her. She is from a low-income family, but she described herself as an industrious farmer. 

Aside from the farming business, Nguon also operates a general store from her house, where she sells various kinds of grocery items to people in her village of Kampong Chhnang province. She typically generates 10,000 KHR each day on average, with which she can afford to pay for food, clothing and allowances for her school-aged children. She is now 43 years of her age and married with seven children – four married children and three single children.

Due to inadequate capital to pay for the operating costs in the farming process, Nguon would like to borrow a loan in the amount of 500,000 KHR from HKL and Kiva. She will pay for plowing fees as well as purchase fertilizers for good growth of her rice crops.

In the future, Nguon wants to expand her farming business so as to experience a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees as well as to purchase fertilizers for good growth of her rice crops.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is engaged in a farming business in the village. He has been in this business for almost 20 years and usually receives 1500 PHP per month. 

Currently, Alberto wants to buy farming inputs that are required for the development of his business but he lacks the needed capital. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP in order to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay for labor costs. He believes that through these inputs, he will be able to reach a high income and increase his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.ru:
Мичгона жительница города Душанбе. Ей 27 лет. Она не замужем. Мичгона живет с родителями. Ее отец занимается торговлей. 
Мичгона более пяти лет занимается торговлей. Она арендует торговую точку на рынке, где занимается торговлей женской одежды. Мичгона просит кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Mijgona is a resident of the city of Dushanbe.  She is 27 years old and unmarried.  Mijgona lives with her parents.  Her father is a businessman.  Mijgona has been a businesswoman for over five years.  She rents a stall at the market where she sells women's clothing.  Mijgona is requesting a loan to increase her sales.

loans.use: to acquire seasonal goods

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Kun has owned and managed a rice farming business for many years. She is 30 years old and happily lives in Baray district with her spouse and a school-aged child. 

Kun doesn’t want to rely on her husband’s income, which is why she has tried hard in pursuing any businesses to generate income by the sweat of her brow. Aside from rice husbandry, Kun is operating a sewing business in the local market, where she restores clothes, pants, robes, and coats and other outerwear, generating approximately 12,000 KHR each day.

Kun needs more clothes and other supplies for her sewing business, which is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of 700,000 KHR from HKL and Kiva. Kun hopes that she will be able to further develop her business through using the loan. And she hopes that her dreams will be attained in order to sustain her family's needs and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and other supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en: Gerardo has been patiently operating his farming business for over 30 years in order to support the needs of his family. Currently, he needs additional working capital to maintain and continue operating his business. He is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. He hopes to continue to grow his business in order to provide a better way of living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Norng

texts.en:
Norng, aged 48, is from Kompong Cham province where she lives peacefully with her spouse and thee school-aged children who are in need of daily allowances. To provide for their children's basic necessities and education, Norng and her spouse work together on their two-and-one-half hectares of farmland upon which they primarily grow rice during the rainy season of the year. They typically each earn approximately 10,000 KHR per day, which they use to cover their daily living costs.

In order to give her rice crop healthier care, Norng would like to take out her fifth loan through HKL to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to apply to her rice field. She hopes to improve her production and enjoy a better harvest this coming season. Norng aims to continue supporting her children’s education with her earned profit.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to apply to her rice field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Дилрабо жительница города Исфара. Ей 31 год. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Муж Дилрабо уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Сама Дилрабо занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном занимается торговлей ткани. Этим видом деятельности она занимается тринадцать лет. Дилрабо просит кредит для приобретения новых видов тканей. Она хочет привезти товар из города Худжанд.
texts.en: Dilrabo is a resident of the city of Isfara.  She is 31 years old, married, and has two children.  Dilrabo's husband moved away to work in the Russian Federation.  Dilrabo has a business at the market.  Primarily, she sells fabric.  She has been in this business for 13 years.  Dilrabo is requesting a loan to acquire new varieties of fabric.  She wants to bring the fabric in from Khudjand.

loans.use: to acquire new varieties of fabric

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.en: Zacarias is a 57-year-old, simple farmer in the village. He has been in the business for 28 years and it flows accordingly. He is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP in order to buy 2 bags of seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. It is his hope that his loan is approved so that he can make his business more productive which will assist with the necessities of his family.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
This is Melecio, he previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more fish to sell. His earnings were a big help for his personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan that will be used to buy more stocks of rice as his new source of income. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily and business needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Melecio hopes that his business will continue to be successful. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of rice.

loans.name: Leus

texts.en:
This is Leus, a resident of Bacoor Cavite Philippines. She is married to Danilo, an office clerk, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Leus operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Leus hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 15,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Myrna hopes to expand soon and acquire a larger place for her store. She dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
This is Domingo. He previously accessed an 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of the transport tricycle. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more spare parts and pay for more maintenance of the tricycle, and to buy some equipment in the repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Domingo dreams of being able to buy another tricycle soon. He also hopes for his children to finish their education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of the tricycle (motorcycle transport vehicle).

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna. She previously accessed a 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan that she used to buy more meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Edna would like to buy a vehicle for the business and hopes to continuously grow her enterprise in the coming years. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Don Santos tiene la edad de 46 años, es casado, tiene 8 hijos, tres ya son independiente y 5 menores de edad, los cuales dependen de él, la Esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del Hogar, Don santos habita en la Comarca Kajinicuil; se dedica a comercializar verduras, y granos basicos los que produce en su parcela que posee en la misma comarca donde habita.  Es una persona responsable, trabajadora, humilde y dedicado a su negocio. Solicita este financimiento para compra de insumos para siembra de Maiz; así como Insecticida, Herbicidas entre otros.  El proposito es obtener en buen estados sus cosechas que sea de calidad para  que a la hora de comercializarlo generen mayor utilidad, esto le permitirá mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su Familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 46 years old, married, and has eight children. Three are independent and five are minors depending on him. His wife is dedicated to taking care of the household chores. 

Santos lives in the comarca of Kajinicuil. He sells vegetables and basic grains that he produces on the parcel of land that he has which is located in the same carmarca as he lives. He is a responsible and hardworking person, humble and dedicated to his business. 

He is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies for planting corn, insecticide, herbicides, among other items. His purpose is to get his crops in a high quality state so that when it is time to sell them he will generate higher income, which will allow him to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, herbicides, and other supplies to help obtain a high quality corn harvest

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en:
Khoem is a 44-year-old, married woman and lives in Kompong Cham Province. Khoem has four adult children, some of whom are currently employed in Phnom Penh and help the family financially. 

Though her children provide financial assistance to Khoem, she does not rely on the remittance of her children. She has been in the rice farming business for almost 30 years and it’s the sole source of her income.

Khoem would like to improve her farming business and ensure a good harvest, so she is asking for a loan in the sum of 1,200,000 KHR to purchase farm inputs needed for her rice field and pay for labor costs incurred in transplanting rice. This loan will enable her to complete her farm work on time. Eventually, she hopes that she can yield higher production from the rice field.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs needed for her rice field and pay for labor costs incurred in transplanting rice.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros, She previously accessed a loan of 15,000 PHP that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP so that she can buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in higher profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

Milagros hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a simple farmer from the village of Gattaran. He makes a living for his family by farming. For 10 years in this work, he has been doing his best to make development. Now it comes again the season for sowing. He is seeking additional working capital in the amount of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. He is hoping that through this loan he can improve his farming business so that his family’s standard of living will be enhanced.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Augusto Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Augusto Tiene la edad de 51 años, casado, su esposa es ama de Casa, Procrearon tres niñas una de 18, 13 y 10 años consecutivos, la mayorcita esta en la Universidad la otra en secundaria y la ultima en la educacion Primaria. Don Augusto es una persona respetuoso, muy querido por sus vecinos y sobre todo responsable; con tanto sacrificio ha sacado adelante a su famlia, habita en la Comaraca Pikin Guerrero, Se dedica a la Ganaderia desde hace mucho tiempo el cual heredó esta actividad de sus padres y la pone en practica ya que tiene experiencia en el ramo y le saca provecho pues comercializa la leche de las vacas paridas y los terneros machos los engorda para venderlos cuando requieran su peso estimado y asi poder sacarle mayor ganancia. Solicita este credito para comprar dos vacas paridas e incrementar su hato ganadero poco a poco.  Su mayor deseo es mantenerse con salud y continuar trabajando para que a su familia no le falte el pan de cada dia.
texts.en: Mr. Augusto is 51 and married, and his wife is a homemaker.  They have three daughters, ages 18, 13 and 10.  The oldest one goes to college, the second one is in secondary school and the youngest is in elementary.  Augusto is a respectable person and very much loved by his neighbors, but above all, he is very responsible.  With a lot of sacrifice he has been able to provide for his family, which lives in the Pikin Guerrero County.  He has been a farmer for a long time, having learned the trade from his parents, and he uses his experience to full advantage by selling milk from his dairy cattle and the calves he fattens to sell for a good profit.  He is requesting a loan to buy cattle to increase his livestock business little by little.  His greatest desire is to stay healthy and continue working to put bread on the table for his family every day.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Maria Lucia Rogelia

texts.es: María Lucia Rogelía aprendió desde pequeña a trabajar en el campo. Su padre le enseñó lo necesario para que pudiera producir su propio café y cuando se caso continuó con esta actividad al lado de su esposo Juan, con quien tuvo 3 hijos. Años después su esposo murió y ella continúa hasta la fecha dedicándose a la producción de café, de maíz y de frijol. Sus hijos ya están casados sin embargo uno de ellos aún la continua ayudando en el trabajo del campo ya que es pesado y no lo puede realizar ella sola. El café que produce es orgánico ya que no utiliza fertilizantes que contengan productos químicos. En la cosecha pasada ella tuvo una producción de 3 toneladas las cuales entregó a las “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para que fueran procesadas y exportadas. Ella tiene un total de 2400 plantas de café y quiere tener 3000 ya que con esto le será posible aumentar su producción en los próximos años. Para lograr ese objetivo ella necesita un crédito pues anteriormente ha trabajado con financiamientos y ha obtenido buenos resultados. También nos comentó que pasando la próxima cosecha le gustaría hacer en su casa dos ventanales para tener una mejor iluminación y así ahorrar dinero en energía eléctrica.
texts.en:
Maria Lucia Rogelia has been working as a farmer since she was young.  Her father taught her all she needed to know about growing coffee; and when she got married she continued her work alongside her husband, Juan, with whom she had three children.  Years later her husband passed away but she has continued until now to produce coffee, corn and beans.  Her children are married, however one of them still helps her on the plantation, since the work is hard and she cannot do it alone.

The coffee she produces is organic and does not use fertilizers that contain chemicals.  During the last harvest she produced 2,400 tons of coffee, but would like to increase it to 3,000 over the next few years.  To meet her goal she is requesting a loan, since her previous loans have given her good results.  She also tells us that after the next harvest she would like to put two new windows in her house to have more light and save on electric energy.

loans.use: To buy coffee plants.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for pork, chicken and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen is 41 years old and a resident of the Baray District, where she operates a rice farming business alongside her spouse to generate income for their livelihoods. In addition, Pen also devotes herself to a hog-fattening business for additional income. Her profit is used for, food, clothing, and allowances for her three school-aged children.

Pen has turned to HKL for another loan for her business. The two previous loans enabled her to make improvements in her farming business as well as her living conditions. The purpose of this loan is to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizers for her rice crops, so that she can ensure a fruitful harvest and yield a better income. She hopes that this loan will be granted to her so that she can further develop her business. She is very thankful for the unending support from kind lenders.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer for her rice crops.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Navy is 37 years old. She is widowed and blessed with one child, in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in breeding pigs for more than two years, earning about $13 per day. 

Because her present house is old, Navy is requesting a loan of $900 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Abe

texts.en: Abe’s source of income comes from his farming business. He has been engaged in this activity for almost 10 years. He plants and harvests rice twice a year and sells it to traders in the village. Abe is continuously generating income to educate his children. He is asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. He hopes to improve his crop production.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Chhun Heng

texts.en:
Chhun Heng is 34 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling vegetables for more than three years, earning about $6 daily. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) runs a taxi service (motor taxi) and earns about $4 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Chhun Heng is requesting a loan of $1,500 to raise capital to purchase more vegetables to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a truck to carry vegetables to sell and to help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Carla De Jesus

texts.es: La Sra. Carla, de 29 años de edad, soltera, tiene dos hijos menores de edad, habita en el Rama, en casa de su mamá, pues Carla asume sus gastos en el hogar; trabaja desde hace mas de 5 años en el INTA como Jornalera, se destaca por ser una persona humilde, trabajadora y de buenas costumbres, ha adquirido sus cosas con esfuerzo propio y sudor de su trabajo.  Actualmente solicita financiamiento para mejorar la casa donde Vive, cambiandole la madera ya que se encuentra en mal estado. Su mayor deseo es mejorar la vivienda donde habita y darle mejor presentacion a la misma; así mismo desea que a su familia no les falte el pan de cada dia y tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carla, 29, is single and has two minor children.  She lives in Rama, in her mother's house, and takes care of the household expenses.  For five years she has been working for INTA as a wage earner, and she is known for being a humble, hard-working, well-mannered person.  She has been able to aquire her possessions through her own efforts and hard work.  

Carla is requesting a loan to renovate the house where she lives, by changing the wood that is in disrepair.  Her greatest desire is to fix up the house so it looks better.  She also wants to make sure her family has everything it needs, including better living conditions.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Gustavo Antonio

texts.es:
Don Gustavo, es hombre trabajador de oficio cocinero chef, que gracia a la experiencia, ha logrado mantener a sus clientes, siempre contando con el apoyo de su esposa en las venta de comida, negocio que tiene en su propia casa, y que pone las mesa en su corredor, dando un ambiente bien campestre. Sus hijos casados. 
Pues para él ha sido un gran reto, ya que cuando comenzo, lo hizo con dinero propio de su liquidación, luego con ganancias y financiamiento, pudo aumentar un poco mas sus ventas,  ofreciendo una mejor variedad de platillos al adquirir un crédito el cual otorgo Afodenic, y que ha venido trabajando a plazos, dando más oportunidad  a su familia.
Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en un quintal de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, bidón de aceite, producto de la coca cola, carne, pollo, pescado, verduras, frutas y un tanque de gas de 100 libras. Logrando mantenerse en equilibrio, aumentar la venta, al hacer más cantidad de comida.
texts.en:
Gustavo works as a chef. Thanks to his experience he has managed to keep his clients, always with the help of his wife in food sales, a business that he has in his own home. He put the table in the corridor, giving it a picnic ambience. His children are married.

Well, for him it has been a great challenge. When he began he did it with his own money from severance pay. Later with earnings and loans he increased his sales a bit more, offering a better variety of meals through a loan he received through Afodenic, and he has paid attention to agreements, providing his family with more opportunities.

With this new loan he will invest in 100 pounds of rice, beans, sugar, a can of oil, Coca-Cola products, meat, chicken, fish, vegetables, fruit and a 100 pound gas tank. Striking a good balance, increasing sales by preparing more food.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, chicken and other items in order to increase his sales and his variety of meals

loans.name: Milona

texts.en:
This is Milona. She previously accessed a loan of 21,000 PHP that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in paying for her children's education and her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 23,000 PHP loan so that she can buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on displayed and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in higher profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this increase in her finances with happiness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Milona dreams of expanding her business and helping her children finish their studies through all her hard work with her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Man is 51 years old. She is married and resides with a son in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running the business of buying rice to resell for more than a year, earning approximately $20 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 daily. One son is employed in Thailand. In order to improve her family’s finances, Man is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase rice to resell. By doing so, she will earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es: El Sr. Felipe tiene la edad de 55 años, casado, tiene dos hijos en la edad de la adolescencia, los cuales estudian. Don Felipe trabaja en el Inta desde hace 6 años, su cargo es de Jornalero, su esposa es Costurera quien lo apoya con la economia familiar. Solicita el apoyo de Kiva para ser beneficiado con un financiamiento el cual destinara para compra de materiales de construccion y poder hacerle un anexo 16 mts2 (un cuarto)  para sus hijos, ya que como estan grandes desean tener su privacidad.  Su mayor sueño es brindarles mayor comodidad a su familia y que sus hijos sean personas preparadas.
texts.en: Felipe, 55, is married and has two adolescent children who are in school.  Felipe has been working for INTA for six years as a wage earner.  His wife is a seamstress who helps with the family economy.  He is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy construction materials so he can add a 16 square meter room to his house for his children, who would like more privacy.  His greatest dream is to make his family more comfortable so his children can get an education.

loans.use: To renovate his house.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 48, resident of Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to her children. At this time, she is working hard to be able to support her children’s educational expenses and provide income for everyday expenses.  

Lolita operates a parlor business. She mainly offers haircutting, coloring, straightening/relaxing, etc. She also offers manicure for fingernails. Some parlors also include massage. She also offers face makeup. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, usually women. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan She will be using the loan to buy more equipment for the parlor. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lolita dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for products and hair treatments needed in her business.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
This is Gertrudes, 64, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Iniego, her business partner. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Gertrudes operates a growing farm. She grows plants and flowers on their farm located in Cavite in the high lands where it is suitable to grow vegetables and flowers. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gertrudes dreams of being able to give her all her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more planting materials and fertilizers for her flower farm.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Hola! , Reciban un afectuoso saludo de todos los peruanos. Hoy les contaré sobre Redmira, una mujer muy emprendedora, y trabajadora, perteneciente al grupo Virgen de Fátima – El Tambo.
Grupo que lleva casi 2 años de conformado, se conocen muy bien, ya que están iniciando su 6 ciclo.
Redmira tiene 55 años de edad, trabaja en su restaurante más de 20 años, y desde que se divorcio aproximadamente 3 años atrás, estableció una pequeña bodega, que lo acondicionó en en un espacio que tenía es su casa.
El sueño que ella tiene, es  de sacar profesional  a su último hijo Luis Edison, como lo hizo con sus tres primeros hijos.
El préstamo que ella solicita es para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, con la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche; productos de primera necesidad.
Redmira, se encuentra agradecida con las personas solidarias de Kiva, por que le permiten mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de todos los integrantes de su grupo.
Redmira es la primera de la derecha, viste una chompa celeste. *En la parte superior izquierda se la ve a Sandra con un polo turquesa, La Sra. Ida con una chompa ploma y  con una casilla celeste Silvia.
texts.en:
Hello!  Warm greetings from Peru.  Today we would like to introduce Redmira, an enterprising, hard-working woman who belongs to the communal bank Virgen de Fatima - El Tambo.  This group has been active for two years, and the members know each other well and are beginning their sixth cycle.  

Redmira, 55, has been running a restaurant for over 20 years; and when she divorced her husband around three years ago she established a small grocery store in her own home.

Her goal is to give her son, Luis Edison, a professional career, just like she did with her oldest three children.

The loan she is requesting is to stock her grocery store.  She plans to buy rice, sugar, oil, milk and other essential needs products.  Redmira is grateful to the supportive people of Kiva, because they allow her to improve her own lifestyle as well as the lifestyle of the other members of the group.

Redmira is the first one on the left, in a blue sweater.  The photos in the top right corner are of Sandra in a turqoise top, Ida in a grey sweater and Silvia in a steel blue sweater.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
This is Carolyn. She previously took a loan of 17,000 PHP that she used to buy trash from collectors. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan that she will again incorporate into her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carolyn hopes that her business will continue to mature and be successful and dreams of providing her children with a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy collected trash for recycling.

loans.name: Sareum

texts.en:
Sareum is 51 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

She is a homemaker. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is involved in cultivating bananas to sell. Approximately, he earns $3 daily. Her children are employed. They earn about $15 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sareum is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase farmland to use for rubber plant cultivation. This money will help her run an additional business and generate extra income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her rubber plantation.

loans.use: to purchase farmland  for rubber plant cultivation

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor is 57 years old, married, and a responsible mother of five children, two of whom are married and three are single. But currently, all of her single children are employed as garment worker in Phnom Penh. As usual, they always send remittances home every month to help their parents financially. Sor and her husband help each other manage their farming business to ensure a high production each harvest season. They have been cultivating rice for over 30 years. 

With the amount she requested through HKL and Kiva, Sor will purchase 10 bags of fertilizers for her rice crops. This will allow a good growth of her crop and she hopes that she will yield a better harvest than in previous years. In the future, Sor plans to expand the land and grow various kinds of seasonal crops for a better income.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of fertilizers for her rice crops.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
This is Aida, who is 50 years old and a resident of GMA, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Ernesto, a driver, and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Aida oversees operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They own one Tricycle unit, a motorcycle with sidecar that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The Tricycle driver then remits a bounty (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and to maintain their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Aida dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her Tricycle motorcycle.

loans.name: Poeurn

texts.en: Poeurn is 62 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling natural medicine for more than 10 years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband runs a watch repair shop. He earns about $3 per day. Her children are employed. In order to improve her family’s finances, Poeurn is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her husband to run a taxi service. This purchase will help him to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her husband to run a taxi service

loans.name: Sophannarith

texts.en: Sophannarith is 26 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) runs a business charging batteries. He earns about $3 per day. Because the present generator is broken, Sophannarith is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a new generator for her husband to run the charging service. In the future, she would like to expand the business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a new generator for her husband to run a charging service

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda is 30 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a food stall for more than two years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about $10 each day. Chenda is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase construction materials for her husband to use in his work. This money will help improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to expand the business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her husband to use in his work

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng is a resident living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She and her husband happily live and operate a farming business there. They have been married for long time but unfortunately, they don’t have any children yet.  She has been planting rice for more than seven years and she has learned good farming practices, which allows her to develop her business gradually while she is operating it. She can generate an average income of 12,800 KHR per day. For additional income, Chheng fattens piglets in her backyard pigpen. Upon maturity, she usually sells them to local traders or butchers in the neighborhood. 

Chheng would like to have financial assistance through HKL to invest in her current businesses in order to make it more viable. She is borrowing 1,000,000 KHR to purchase fertilizers to apply to her rice crop and to purchase more piglets and feed. Through her perseverance and effort, she believes that she can attain a good living standard someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to apply on her rice crop and to purchase more piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
This is Clarita, a resident of Manila Philippines. She is married to Ernesto, a driver and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Clarita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Clarita hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and other products to sell

loans.name: Fatima Petrona

texts.es:
Doña Fátima hoy en día, labora en una empresa de zona franca, como operaria, obteniendo mejor estabilidad económica, su trabajo siempre ha sido la costura, servicio que sigue dando, mas los fines de semana en su casa, teniendo esta otra entrada para solventar sus gastos, salió del taller que estaba con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos, ya que en zona franca le pagan las horas extras, y con eso se ayuda para seguir apoyando  a su hijo estudiante de la primaria.
Ha logrado mejorar   su casa, al optar al financiamiento, teniendo mejor oportunidad para salir adelante, con este nuevo préstamo podrá comenzar hacer un muro, el cual tiene con zinc, y desea reguardar su propiedad y cuidar más  a si hijo, al no estar cerca de casa. Materiales a comprar: piedra, arena, cementó, piedrín, tablas y comenzar la obra
texts.en:
Fátima now works as an operator for a company in the free trade zone, and she is getting better financial stability.  Her work has always been sewing, a service that she continues to provide, more on the week-ends, at her house.  With this she has another income for paying her expenses.

She left the workshop she worked in to improve her income.  In the free trade zone they pay for overtime, and this helps her to continue supporting her son, who is in elementary school.

She has managed to improve her house upon opting for the loan, and she has a better chance of getting ahead.  With this new loan she will be able to start making a wall, which is now zinc.  She wishes to safeguard her property and be more careful with her son because she is not close to home.

The materials she will buy are stone, sand, cement, gravel, and wooden planks to start the work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to start building a wall.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Sokhom is 38 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been making piggy banks to sell for more than eight years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (Tuk Tuk taxi). He earns about $3 daily. In order to improve her business, Sokhom is requesting a loan of $600 to raise capital in her business to purchase more clay to make more piggy banks to sell. By doing so, she will earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase clay to make more piggy banks to sell

loans.name: Barrio Sucre  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Barrio Sucre está formado por 12 mujeres trabajadoras, que día a día buscan la forma de superarse y sacar  adelante a sus familias, viven por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, esta parroquia tiene una geografía accidentada, su clima es frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y al comercio.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Margarita, forma parte del banco comunal Barrio Sucre hace 4 años, tiene 62 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, 6 de ellos son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero tiene apenas 15 años y estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña María Margarita se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y también cría  gallinas,  cuyes y vacas las cuales le producen leche, los cuyes, las gallinas y la leche las vende en su comunidad. También labora en la agricultura la cual es solo para el  consumo de su hogar.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para mejorar sus potreros donde tiene sus vacas.
