Gliceria hopes to grow her business and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna.  She previously received a PHP 30,000 that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lorna hopes her business grows more in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita.  She previously received a PHP 14,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nenita dreams that her business will become bigger and she will be able to enjoy life with good health and abundance. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God as she studies. 

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Gulsora

texts.ru: Гулсора успешная,трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина.    Она замужем, имеет троих детей. В поисках источника дохода в 2000 году она начала свой бизнес в месте со свекровью.    Они занимаются продажей свадебных платьев. У них имеется свой свадебный салон и там они продают свадебные платья.   А муж ее предприниматель а также помогает Гулсоре по бизнесу.   Так как у нас осенью начинается сезон свадеб Гулсора хочет расширить свой товарооборот и закупить несколько свадебных платьев.    Поэтому она обратилась в нашу организацию и надеется на нашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulsora is a successful, hard-working and conscientious woman. She is married and has three children. Looking for a source of income, she launched her own business in 2000 together with her mother-in-law. They sell wedding dresses at their own salon. Gulsora's husband is an entrepreneur, but also helps his wife with her business. 

As Tajikistan's wedding season begins in the fall, Gulsora would like to expand her inventory and buy several new wedding dresses. For this reason, she has turned to MDO Arvand, LLC and hopes for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses for her shop

loans.name: Gullapungro  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
Este es el primer crédito que realizan todas las integrantes del banco comuna Gullanpugro, se enteraron de este crédito por otras amigas de la comunidad que ya forman parte de otros bancos comunales, son 8 mujeres humildes y trabajadoras, se dedican en su mayor parte a la cría de animales y a la agricultura ya que les gusta el trabajo del campo, algunos salen a laborar en la ciudad en especial los jóvenes. Viven por el cantón Nabón lugar que tiene un clima muy frió, cuenta con varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gastronomía es típica al igual que la vestimenta de su gente las mismas que la lucen muy orgullosas de aun mantener viva su cultura. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Elvira, tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, tres de sus hijos trabajan y viven independientes, sus otros tres hijos estudian a distancia, también trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, solo una de sus hijas trabaja para sus gastos personales. Su esposo labora como agricultor, la casa en la que vive es el fruto del arduo trabajo conyugal.

Doña María Elvira forma parte de una organización en la cual se dedican a la siembra en viveros de diferentes flores y otras plantas, las mismas que venden en la ciudad en masetas, esta actividad la desempeña hace 10 años, también se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas  y sus cosechas las vende, tiene varios animales como son: cerdos, borregos, cuyes y ganado del cual obtiene la leche que la vende en su comunidad.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para continuar con los viveros.
 
Su meta es  creer en la crianza de ganado.
texts.en:
This is the first loan the members of the “Gullanpugro” communal bank have taken out.  They found out about the loan through other girlfriends in the community who are already members of other communal banks.  They are 8 humble, hardworking women who for the most part work raising animals and in agriculture because they like working in the fields.  Some of them, especially the young ones, go to work in the city.  They live in Nabón Canton, a place with a very cold climate that has many places were nature can be enjoyed.  Its cuisine and the clothing the people wear are traditional and people wear them proud to be able to still maintain their culture alive.

One of the group members is María Elvira, 46.  She’s married and has 7 children.  Three of her children work and live on their own and her other three are in distance education programs and also work and help her out economically.  Only one of her daughters works for to cover her own personal expenses.  Her husband works as a farmer and the house they live in is the fruit of their hard labor as a couple.

María Elvira forms part of an organization that plants various flowers and other plants in nurseries that are then potted and sold in the city.  She’s been in this activity for 10 years.  She also grows vegetables that she sells and has various animals like pigs, sheep, guinea pigs and dairy cattle that produce milk she sells in her community.

She will use the loan to buy manure to continue with the nurseries.  Her goal is to expand the cattle raising.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis Eduardo se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a la venta de pescado y con este negocio ha generado los ingresos que requiere para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Debido a que sus padres se dedicaban a esta actividad, Luis Eduardo la aprendió desde muy temprana edad y esto le permitió conocer como se manejaba el negocio, y ahora gracias a la experiencia puede sobrevivir con la venta de pescado y ofrecerle a su familia una calidad de vida digna. Anteriormente trabajaba vendiendo en una caja sus pescados y gracias a que sus clientes iban aumentando tuvo la necesidad de obtener un transporte, y así compró el vehículo donde ahora transporta los pescados y los vende a sus clientes. Buscando superar la dificultad de capital que tiene, Luis Eduardo busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de pescados y responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Su sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y que gracias a el sus hijos puedan tener una educación de buena calidad. Además, lograr tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y ofrecerles mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Luis Eduardo has dedicated much of his life to selling fish and has generated income from this business. He needs this income to manage household costs of his home, in which he lives with his wife and four children. Since his parents worked in this business, Luis Eduardo learned the work from a vary early age and this has allowed him to know how to manage the business. Now, thanks to this experience, he can make a living by selling fish and provide his family with a decent quality of life. Previously, he had worked by selling his fish in a box. Since his customers were increasing, he had to find transportation, so he bought a vehicle that he now uses to transport the fish and sell them to customers. Looking to increase the capital he has, Luis Eduardo is requesting a loan to buy assorted fish and respond to customer requests.

His dream is to improve and move forward with his business. Thanks to this, his children can have a quality education. Also, he wants to provide a better quality of life for his family and offer them better economic opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish and respond to customer requests

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn.  She previously received a PHP 15,000 loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products for her new business, which is a variety store. (In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5's worth of cooking oil, or an egg.) The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. 

Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn hopes to grow her business and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more fabric and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.ru: Хамида родилась 1994 года в городе Душанбе. Она очень способная девушка, окончила школу с отличием и поступила в Технологический Университет Таджикистана в факультет Управление внешнеэкономической деятельности. Хамида хочет стать хорошим экономистом. Ее мать работает бухгалтером в телекомпании и получает маленькую зарплату, которая не хватает для оплаты учебы. Хамида запрашивает кредит на сумму 1000 долларов США для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Hamida was born in Dushanbe in 1994. She is a very bright young woman. Hamida graduated from high school with honors and has been accepted to the Technological University of Tajikistan to study at the Department of International Business Management.
Hamida wants to become a good economist. Her mother works as an accountant in a television company and earns a low salary that is not enough to pay for Hamida's education. Hamida has requested a loan of 1,000 USD to pay her tuition. She appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her tuition

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa Emilia es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar por grandes adversidades en la vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar brindándoles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos. Madre soltera cabeza de hogar de sus 10 hijos, pues su esposo murió hace un tiempo, Rosa Emilia aún debe garantizar una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos, pues a pesar de que algunos ya se encuentran grandes y tienen sus propios trabajos, todavía tiene 3 hijos que les debe garantizar el acceso a una educación de buena calidad y el sustento diario. Para poder generar sus ingresos Rosa Emilia tiene una venta de comidas, y debido a que sus clientes se lo han venido solicitando, espera comenzar con una fábrica de arepas para venderlas en su municipio. Ya que no cuenta con un gran capital para esto, Rosa Emilia busca un préstamo para comprar un molino eléctrico, los utensilios necesarios y los insumos para comenzar a fabricar arepas.

Su sueño es que sus hijos salgan adelante y con su apoyo puedan tener acceso a una educación de buena calidad. Además, aspira a tener un buen negocio que sea bien organizado y les permita prosperar.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia is a person who has had to pass through great adversities in her life; however, she has always had the strength to move forward and continue providing a good quality of life for her children.  She is a single mother and the head of her home with 10 children.  Her husband died awhile ago, and Rosa Emilia still wants to guarentee a good quality of life for her children, even though some are already grown and have their own jobs.  She still has 3 children that she wants to grant access to a good quality education and provide for their daily needs.  In order to generate income, Rosa Emilia has a business preparing and selling meals and since her customers have come to her with requests, she hopes to start making arepas to sell in her municipality.  Since she doesn't have much capital for this, Rosa Emilia requests a loan to purchase an electric mill, necessary utensils, and supplies to begin making arepas.

Her dream is that her children succeed and with her support can have access to a good quality education.  Moreover, she aspires to have a good business that is well-organized and allows her to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase an electric mill, necessary utensils, and the supplies to begin to make arepas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pig and pay for its care, and to be able to fulfill her clients' requests.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Naudel Antonio

texts.es:
Naudel es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y esto le ha permitido obtener los ingresos que requiere en su hogar para poder brindar el sustento necesario. Durante gran parte de su vida se ha dedicado a la actividad de la agricultura y el campo, y gracias a esta experiencia tiene la oportunidad de ser reconocido por tener productos de muy buena calidad. Actualmente tiene una cerda y esta está en etapa de gestación, por lo que las crías ya pronto le generarán unos ingresos que requiere. Pero debido a que los pedidos de sus clientes no los puede abastecer completamente, Naudel busca un préstamo para comprar un cerdo y aumentar su capacidad de producción para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida y ofrecerles un buen crecimiento a su hijo recién nacido y su hijo de 8 años.
texts.en: Naudel’s a person who has always been noted for being very hardworking and this has made it possible for him to earn income to provide his home with the necessary support.  For a great part of his life he’s worked in agriculture and in the fields and thanks to this experience he’s well-known for producing very good quality products.  He currently has a pregnant sow so piglets will soon produce income he needs.  But because he can’t completely fill customer orders, Naudel needs a loan to buy a pig to increase production capacity and respond to customer orders.  His greatest dream is to be able to provide his family with a good quality of life and offer good growth to his newborn son and to his 8-year-old son.

loans.use: to buy a pig.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 57, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Felix who works abroad. She is a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nenita operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nenita hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
This is Analiza.  She previously received a PHP 10,000 loan that she used in buying raw materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy raw materials needed in her bakery. 

Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Analiza hopes her business would grow and dreams of being able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
This is Julie. She previously took out a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Julie hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung was born in 1982. She has five children. They are learning at secondary school, primary school, and kindergarten. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Dung sells fruits and raises pigs for a living and gains from it 4,000,000 VND per month. The total earnings of her family is about 7,000,000 VND per month. 

She has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to enlarge her fruit stall. Then, she hopes her business can get enough money to pay for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to enlarge her fruit stall.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
la Señora Rosa, habita  en el municipio de la concepcion, su esposa quien la apoya incondicionalmente con los gastos del hogar y los dos juntos an salido adelante con mucho esfuerzo en su trabajo, ellos quieren darle una mejor vida a sus hijos y mejor de condiciones, tener mejores ingresos. en estos momento  doña Rosa tiene 2 manzanas de Pitahaya y necesita darle mantenimiento ya que con las condicones del clima y las diferentes plagas que asechan su cultivo requiere de mucho capital, Gracias a este nuevo prestamo podra comprar los siguientes insumos: Completo, Urea, Cobre, Molatien entre otros, con esto sus cultivos creceran y seran de mejor calidad y asi podra venderlos a un buen precio. 
Agradece a Afodenic quien atravez de Fondos Kiva le han apoyado con este Finaciamiento.
texts.en: Rosa lives in the town of La Concepcion. Her spouse helps out with the household costs and together they are getting ahead through their hard work. They want to give their kids a better life, better living conditions, and have more income. Right now Rosa has two plots of dragonfruit and needs to care for them since climate conditions and various blights which threaten her crop require a lot of money. Thanks to this new loan she will be able to buy the following supplies: urea, fertilizer, copper, insecticide etc. With that her yield will grow and be of a higher quality, and she can also sell it at a higher price. She thanks Afodenic who through Kiva funding has supported her with this financing.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain her two plots of dragonfruit.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y esto le ha permitido superar las grandes dificultades que se le han presentado en la vida. Desde muy joven aprendió la actividad de la agricultura junto a su padre, y es en esta actividad que siempre se ha desempeñado y con la cual ha generado los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su esposa y sus 8 hijos. Gracias a la experiencia que tiene, es reconocido por sacar productos de muy buena calidad, lo que hace que sus clientes sigan creciendo y le brinden mayores oportunidades para progresar en la vida junto a su familia. A pesar de que algunos de sus hijos ya son mayores y tienen su propio empleo, Luis aún debe garantizar el acceso a una educación universitaria a sus otros hijos y por esto las condiciones económicas en su hogar se han visto fuertemente afectadas. Buscando seguir saliendo adelante con su cultivo, Luis busca un préstamo para comprar semillas, riegos y abonos para sacar adelante su cultivo.

Su mayor sueño es ver a todos sus hijos progresando y brindándoles una buena calidad de vida a sus familias, de modo que se pueda sentir a gusto con la educación y la calidad de vida que les ha brindado.
texts.en:
Luis is a person who has always been described as being very hardworking. That has allowed him to overcome the great difficulties that have occurred in his life. When he was very young he learned the agriculture business with his father. He’s always worked in this business which has generated the income necessary to support his wife and their 8 kids. Thanks to his experience, he’s known for producing high quality products. His client base has grown and has brought him better opportunities to progress in life together with his family. Despite some of his kids already being grown and having their own work, Luis still has to guarantee access to a university education to his other kids and so the economic condition of the household has been greatly affected. Aiming to continue getting ahead through his farming, Luis is looking for a loan to buy seeds, irrigation, and manure to move ahead with his crop.

His greatest dream is to see all of his kids progressing and giving their families a good quality of life, so that he can feel good about the education and quality of life he’s given them.

loans.use: to buy seeds, irrigation, and manure for farming.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
Maria tiene experiencia de 10 años en la actividad de la confección y trabajó durante mucho tiempo en una empresa, pero debido a que el padre de sus hijos la abandonó hace un tiempo, Maria ha quedado a cargo de las obligaciones de su hogar donde convive con sus 2 hijos y a quienes les debe garantizar una buena calidad de vida. En busca de tener mayores ingresos, Maria se puso en la ardua tarea de montar su propio taller de confección, y ya hace un año aproximadamente que montó su taller el cual a pesar de iniciarlo con muy poco capital, ha logrado sacar adelante con el esfuerzo que hace diariamente. Buscando ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina plana con la que pueda ofrecer el servicio de confección completo. 

Su mayor sueño es que sus 2 hijos tengan acceso a una educación de buena calidad y en un futuro a una educación universitaria. Además aspira a que su taller de confección pueda salir adelante y algún día generar empleo para otras personas muy necesitadas.
texts.en:
María has ten years’ experience making clothes and worked for a firm for many years.  But because the father of her children abandoned them some time ago, María was left in charge of all household obligations.  She lives with her two children and she must insure a good quality of life for them.

Seeking to earn higher income, María set the difficult goal of setting up her own sewing workshop and about a year ago started her own workshop that although she started out with little capital,  she’s managed to move forward thanks to her constant efforts.  In order to provide better customers service, María is looking for a loan to buy a straight-stitch sewing machine to be able to offer all-inclusive sewing services.

Her greatest dream is that her two children have access to a good quality education and in future to a university education.  She also hopes her sewing workshop will move forward and one day employs other very needy people.

loans.use: to buy  sewing machine.

loans.name: Lourdeliza

texts.en:
This is Lourdeliza, 36, a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Michael, a baker's helper, and a mother to her child. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Lourdeliza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lourdeliza hopes to grow her business and dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, she previously accessed a 20,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan that she used in buying raw materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 16,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy raw materials needed in printing. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Evangeline hopes to grow her business and dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Remelita

texts.en:
This is Remelita, 34, a resident of Manila in the Philippines. She is married to Marco, a driver, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Remelita maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer's prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are depending on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Remelita hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to have a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Honesto

texts.en:
This is Honesto. He previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities and varieties of medicines to expand his inventory. His earnings were a big help for the education of his child and in his personal, household, and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan so he can buy more quantities and varieties of medicines. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in his heart.

Honesto hopes that his business will continue to be successful. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for medicines and products needed in his business
